speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me a bit more about when you first started noticing these symptoms? Was it a sudden onset or did they develop over time?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's been a few days, I guess. I just felt a bit off, and my mom said I didn't want to eat my favorite foods, so I wasn't eating much. I was playing outside with my brother, but I got tired easily and had to sit down a lot."

speaker: Doctor
text: When did you first start feeling unwell? Was it a gradual change or did it come on suddenly?

speaker: Patient
text: "I think it was kinda sudden, doc. I just woke up and didn't feel like getting out of bed, and when I did, I got really tired easily. I couldn't run around with my brother like I usually do."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the severity of your symptoms? How would you describe your breathing difficulties - is it labored, rapid, or does it come and go?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's really fast, doc. I take really deep breaths, and it feels like I'm not getting enough air, even when I'm just sitting still. It's kinda hard to explain, but it's like my body is working really hard to breathe."

speaker: Doctor
text: "When did you first start experiencing these symptoms? Were they constant or did they occur at specific times of the day or in certain situations?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Uh-huh, yeah... I think it was in the morning, when I woke up. I don't know, it just kinda felt like that all day. Sometimes when I'm playing, I'll get really tired and need to sit down, but when I'm just sitting, I can still breathe okay."

speaker: Doctor
text:

Also, I'd like to request a test: REQUEST TEST: Liver Function Panel.

speaker: Doctor
text:
How long have you noticed that your liver feels swollen? Is it something that you've been aware of for a few days, or is it a more recent development?



Also, can you point out to me exactly where you feel the pain or tenderness in your abdomen, is it more on one side or does it feel like it's distributed throughout?

speaker: Patient
text:
"Uh, I don't really know... I think it's been a few days? My mom said the doctor said it's big, but I don't really know what that means. I just know it feels funny when I sit on my mom's lap and she can feel it."

"No, doc, it's not just on one side, it feels all around my tummy. It's kinda hard to explain, but it feels like my tummy is a bit bloated, like when I eat too much. But I haven't eaten much, so I don't know..."

"It's in my legs, doc. My legs feel funny when I stand up. They get all squishy and tight, and it's hard to walk. I have to sit down a lot so I don't get too tired."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Thank you for answering my questions so far. I'd like to take a closer look at your abdomen. Can you please turn over and let me examine the back of your abdomen as well? I'm also going to listen to your lungs with a stethoscope to get a better understanding of your breathing difficulties."

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, doc... I'll turn over. *turns over* Oh, wait, I don't feel comfortable on my back. Can I just sit up instead?"

speaker: Patient
text: "I'm a kid, doc. I play outside with my brother, and I like to run around. We play tag and hide-and-seek. I also like to ride my tricycle and play with Legos. I don't really do anything special, just normal stuff. My mom does all the cooking and cleaning at home."

speaker: Doctor
text:
I've taken note of your occupation and daily activities. Can you tell me more about your typical daily routine, including your diet and any medications you're currently taking? 

Also, have you noticed any changes in your urine output or color - is it darker or more frequent than usual?

speaker: Patient
text: "Hmm... I think my mom makes me eat oatmeal for breakfast, and sometimes we have sandwiches or chicken nuggets. I like chicken nuggets, they're yummy. I also like applesauce and yogurt. I don't really eat much else, though. My mom says I need to eat more, but I don't feel like it. Sometimes I have juice, but not too much. I'm not sure if I'm taking any medications, my mom just gives me acetaminophen when I have a fever. But I don't have a fever right now. And... I don't really drink much water, I like juice and soda better."
